title: Modeling Atomistically Assembled Diffractive Optics in Solids
authors: Trevor Kling, Dong-yeop Na, Mahdi Hosseini
abstract:
We develop a model describing long-range atom-atom interactions in a
two-dimensional periodic or aperiodic lattice of optical centers inside a
solid-state host material. We consider realistic environmental and technical
conditions such as frequency and position broadening. Even when considering a
significant frequency broadening in the ensemble (approximately 300 GHz), we
observe up to a three-fold increase in directional scattering from the resonant
lattice in a system. The model can be used to scalably design quantum optical
elements, e.g. a quantum lens, harnessing atomistic engineering (e.g. via ion
implantation) of collective interactions in materials to enhance quantum
properties.
